column4: Level 1 Definition
column5: Level 2 Definition
column6: Examples

column4: Threats from human settlements or other non-agricultural land uses with a substantial footprint
column5: Human cities, towns, and settlements including non-housing development typically integrated with housing
column6: urban areas, suburbs, villages, vacation homes, shopping areas, offices, schools, hospitals

column4: Threats from human settlements or other non-agricultural land uses with a substantial footprint
column5: Factories and other commercial centers
column6: manufacturing plants, shopping centers, office parks, military bases, power plants, train & ship yards, airports

column4: Threats from human settlements or other non-agricultural land uses with a substantial footprint
column5: Tourism and recreation sites with a substantial footprint
column6: ski areas, golf courses, beach resorts, cricket fields, county parks, campgrounds

column4: Threats from farming and ranching as a result of agricultural expansion, intensification or practices; includes silviculture, mariculture and aquaculture
column5: Crops planted for food, fodder, fiber, fuel, or other uses
column6: farms, household swidden plots, plantations, orchards, vineyards, mixed agroforestry systems

column4: Threats from farming and ranching as a result of agricultural expansion, intensification or practices; includes silviculture, mariculture and aquaculture
column5: Stands of trees planted for timber or fiber outside of natural forests, often with non-native species
column6: teak or eucalyptus plantations, silviculture, christmas tree farms

column4: Threats from farming and ranching as a result of agricultural expansion, intensification or practices; includes silviculture, mariculture and aquaculture
column5: Domestic terrestrial animals raised in one location on farmed or non-local resources (farming); also domestic or semi-domesticated animals allowed to roam in the wild and supported by natural habitats (ranching)
column6: cattle feed lots, dairy farms, cattle ranching, chicken farms, goat, camel, or yak herding

column4: Threats from farming and ranching as a result of agricultural expansion, intensification or practices; includes silviculture, mariculture and aquaculture
column5: Aquatic animals raised in one location on farmed or non-local resources; also hatchery fish allowed to roam in the wild
column6: shrimp or fin fish aquaculture, fish ponds on farms, hatchery salmon, seeded shellfish beds, artificial algal beds

column4: Threats from production of non-biological resources
column5: Exploring for, developing and producing petroleum and other liquid hydrocarbons
column6: oil wells, deep sea natural gas drilling

column4: Threats from production of non-biological resources
column5: Exploring for, developing and producing minerals and rocks
column6: coal mines, alluvial gold panning, gold mines, rock quarries, coral mining, deep sea nodules, guano harvesting

column4: Threats from production of non-biological resources
column5: Exploring, developing and producing renewable energy
column6: geothermal power production, solar farms, wind farms (including birds or bats flying into windmills), tidal farms

column4: Threats from long, narrow transport corridors and the vehicles that use them including associated wildlife mortality
column5: Surface transport on roadways and dedicated tracks
column6: highways, secondary roads, logging roads, bridges & causeways, road kill, fencing associated with roads, railroads

column4: Threats from long, narrow transport corridors and the vehicles that use them including associated wildlife mortality
column5: Transport of energy & resources
column6: electrical & phone wires, aqueducts, oil & gas pipelines, electrocution of wildlife

column4: Threats from long, narrow transport corridors and the vehicles that use them including associated wildlife mortality
column5: Transport on and in freshwater and ocean waterways
column6: dredging, canals, shipping lanes, ships running into whales, wakes from cargo ships

column4: Threats from long, narrow transport corridors and the vehicles that use them including associated wildlife mortality
column5: Air and space transport
column6: flight paths, jets impacting birds

column4: Threats from consumptive use of wild" biological resources including deliberate and unintentional harvesting effects; also persecution or control of specific species"
column5: Killing or trapping terrestrial wild animals or animal products for commercial, recreation, subsistence, research or cultural purposes, or for control/persecution reasons; includes accidental mortality/bycatch
column6: bushmeat hunting, trophy hunting, fur trapping, insect collecting, honey or bird nest hunting, predator control, pest control, persecution

column4: Threats from consumptive use of wild" biological resources including deliberate and unintentional harvesting effects; also persecution or control of specific species"
column5: Harvesting plants, fungi, and other non-timber/non-animal products for commercial, recreation, subsistence, research or cultural purposes, or for control reasons
column6: wild mushrooms, forage for stall fed animals, orchids, rattan, control of host plants to combat timber diseases

column4: Threats from consumptive use of wild" biological resources including deliberate and unintentional harvesting effects; also persecution or control of specific species"
column5: Harvesting trees and other woody vegetation for timber, fiber, or fuel, including site preparation and other forestry management practices
column6: clear cutting of hardwoods, selective commercial logging of ironwood, pulp operations, fuel wood collection, charcoal production

column4: Threats from consumptive use of wild" biological resources including deliberate and unintentional harvesting effects; also persecution or control of specific species"
column5: Harvesting aquatic wild animals or plants for commercial, recreation, subsistence, research or cultural purposes, or for control/persecution reasons; includes accidental mortality/bycatch
column6: trawling, blast fishing, spear fishing, shellfish harvesting, whaling, seal hunting, turtle egg collection, live coral collection, seaweed collection

column4: Threats from human activities that alter, destroy and disturb habitats and species associated with non-consumptive uses of biological resources
column5: People spending time in nature or traveling in vehicles outside of established transport corridors, usually for recreational reasons
column6: off-road vehicles, motorboats, jet-skis, snowmobiles, ultralight planes, dive boats, whale watching, mountain bikes, hikers, birdwatchers, skiers, pets in recreational areas, temporary campsites, caving, rock-climbing

column4: Threats from human activities that alter, destroy and disturb habitats and species associated with non-consumptive uses of biological resources
column5: Actions by formal or paramilitary forces without a permanent footprint
column6: armed conflict, mine fields, tanks & other military vehicles, training exercises & ranges, defoliation, munitions testing

column4: Threats from human activities that alter, destroy and disturb habitats and species associated with non-consumptive uses of biological resources
column5: People spending time in or traveling in natural environments for reasons other than recreation or military activities
column6: law enforcement, drug smugglers, illegal immigrants, species research, vandalism

column4: Threats from actions that convert or degrade habitat in service of managing" natural or semi-natural systems, often to improve human welfare"
column5: Suppression or increase in fire frequency and/or intensity outside of its natural range of variation
column6: fire suppression to protect homes, inappropriate fire management, escaped agricultural fires, arson, campfires, fires for hunting

column4: Threats from actions that convert or degrade habitat in service of managing" natural or semi-natural systems, often to improve human welfare"
column5: Changing water flow patterns from their natural range of variation either deliberately or as a result of other activities
column6: dam construction, dam operations, sediment control, change in salt regime, wetland filling for mosquito control, levees and dikes, surface water diversion, groundwater pumping, channelization, artificial lakes

column4: Threats from actions that convert or degrade habitat in service of managing" natural or semi-natural systems, often to improve human welfare"
column5: Other actions that convert or degrade habitat in service of managing" natural systems to improve human welfare"
column6: land reclamation projects, rip-rap along shoreline, mowing grass, tree thinning in parks, beach construction, removal of snags from streams

column4: Threats from actions that convert or degrade habitat in service of managing" natural or semi-natural systems, often to improve human welfare"
column5: Absence or reduction of current or historical maintenance regimes important for key ecological attributes. Includes regimes historically maintained by protected area staff, farmers and ranchers, indigenous peoples, private landowners, or any other resource manager.
column6: lack of mowing of meadows, reduction in controlled burns, lack of indigenous management of key ecosystems, ceasing supplemental feeding of condors

column4: Threats from non-native and native plants, animals, pathogens/microbes, or genetic materials that have or are predicted to have harmful effects on biodiversity following their introduction, spread and/or increase in abundance or virulence
column5: Harmful plants and animals not originally found within the ecosystem(s) in question and directly or indirectly introduced and spread into it by human activities
column6: feral horses, feral household pets, zebra mussels, Miconia tree, introduction of species for biocontrol

column4: Threats from non-native and native plants, animals, pathogens/microbes, or genetic materials that have or are predicted to have harmful effects on biodiversity following their introduction, spread and/or increase in abundance or virulence
column5: Harmful plants and animals, that are originally found within the ecosystem(s) in question, but have become out-of-balance" or "released" directly or indirectly due to human activities"
column6: overabundant native deer, overabundant algae due to loss of native grazing fish, plague affecting rodents, invasive grasses native plants that hybridize with other plants, plague affecting rodents

column4: Threats from non-native and native plants, animals, pathogens/microbes, or genetic materials that have or are predicted to have harmful effects on biodiversity following their introduction, spread and/or increase in abundance or virulence
column5: Human altered or transported organisms or genes
column6: pesticide resistant crops, hatchery salmon, restoration projects using non-local seed stock, genetically modified insects for biocontrol, genetically modified trees, genetically modified salmon

column4: Threats from non-native and native plants, animals, pathogens/microbes, or genetic materials that have or are predicted to have harmful effects on biodiversity following their introduction, spread and/or increase in abundance or virulence
column5: Harmful native and non-native agents that cause disease or illness to a host, including bacteria, viruses, prions, fungi, and other microorganisms
column6: plague affecting rodents, Dutch elm disease or chestnut blight, Chytrid fungus affecting amphibians outside of Africa

column4: Threats from introduction of exotic and/or excess materials or energy from point and nonpoint sources
column5: Water-borne sewage and non-point runoff from housing and urban areas that include nutrients, toxic chemicals and/or sediments
column6: discharge from municipal waste treatment plants, leaking septic systems, untreated sewage, outhouses, oil or sediment from roads, fertilizers and pesticides from lawns and golf-courses, road salt

column4: Threats from introduction of exotic and/or excess materials or energy from point and nonpoint sources
column5: Water-borne pollutants from industrial and military sources including mining, energy production and other resource extraction industries that include nutrients, toxic chemicals and/or sediments
column6: toxic chemicals from factories, illegal dumping of chemicals, mine tailings, arsenic from gold mining, leakage from fuel tanks, PCBs in river sediments

column4: Threats from introduction of exotic and/or excess materials or energy from point and nonpoint sources
column5: Water-borne pollutants from agricultural, silivicultural, and aquaculture systems that include nutrients, toxic chemicals and/or sediments including the effects of these pollutants on the site where they are applied
column6: nutrient loading from fertilizer run-off, herbicide run-off, manure from feedlots, nutrients from aquaculture, soil erosion

column4: Threats from introduction of exotic and/or excess materials or energy from point and nonpoint sources
column5: Rubbish and other solid materials including those that entangle wildlife
column6: municipal waste, litter from cars, flotsam & jetsam from recreational boats, waste that entangles wildlife, construction debris

column4: Threats from introduction of exotic and/or excess materials or energy from point and nonpoint sources
column5: Atmospheric pollutants from point and nonpoint sources
column6: acid rain, smog from vehicle emissions, excess nitrogen deposition, radioactive fallout, wind dispersion of pollutants or sediments from farm fields, smoke from forest fires or wood stoves

column4: Threats from introduction of exotic and/or excess materials or energy from point and nonpoint sources
column5: Inputs of heat, sound or light that disturb wildlife or ecosystems
column6: noise from highways or airplanes, sonar from submarines that disturbs whales, heated water from power plants, lamps attracting insects, beach lights disorienting turtles, atmospheric radiation from ozone holes

column4: Threats from catastrophic geological events
column5: Volcanic events
column6: eruptions, emissions of volcanic gasses

column4: Threats from catastrophic geological events
column5: Earthquakes and associated events
column6: earthquakes, tsunamis

column4: Threats from catastrophic geological events
column5: Avalanches or landslides
column6: avalanches, landslides, mudslides

column4: Change in climate patterns (e.g. those resulting from increased atmospheric greenhouse gases like CO2) and/or events outside the natural range of variation that could wipe out a vulnerable species or ecosystem
column5: Large-scale effects of ecosystems shifting and impinging on other species and ecosystems
column6: sea level rise (inundation of shoreline ecosystems, drowning of coral reefs), desertification (sand dune encroachment)

column4: Change in climate patterns (e.g. those resulting from increased atmospheric greenhouse gases like CO2) and/or events outside the natural range of variation that could wipe out a vulnerable species or ecosystem
column5: Broad-scale changes in the geochemical conditions of ecosystems including ocean acidification
column6: ocean acidification, changes in atmospheric CO2 affecting plant growth, loss of sediment leading to broad-scale subsidence

column4: Change in climate patterns (e.g. those resulting from increased atmospheric greenhouse gases like CO2) and/or events outside the natural range of variation that could wipe out a vulnerable species or ecosystem
column5: Broad-scale changes in temperature mean, variability, seasonality and extremes, including changes in temperature extremes, increased average summer temperature, and decreased minimum winter/spring temperature
column6: heat waves, cold spells, oceanic temperature changes, melting of glaciers/sea ice

column4: Change in climate patterns (e.g. those resulting from increased atmospheric greenhouse gases like CO2) and/or events outside the natural range of variation that could wipe out a vulnerable species or ecosystem
column5: Broad-scale changes in precipitation mean, variability, seasonality, and extremes, including decreased or increased precipitation, changes in timing of precipitation, changes in form of precipitation (e.g. snow vs rain; snowcover and snowpack where applicable), changes in evapotranspiration rates and hydrological cycles, and droughts and floods
column6: droughts, changes in timing of rains, loss of snowcover, increased severity of floods

column4: Change in climate patterns (e.g. those resulting from increased atmospheric greenhouse gases like CO2) and/or events outside the natural range of variation that could wipe out a vulnerable species or ecosystem
column5: Changes in frequency, timing and/or intensity of storms as well as severe weather events that threaten targets that have lost resilience
column6: thunderstorms, tropical storms, hurricanes, cyclones, tornadoes, hailstorms, ice storms or blizzards, dust storms, erosion of beaches during storms
